page.title: 05Castle Hill
page.content: continued. The Triumphal Arch was built in 1959 on a hill overlooking Castle Hill, in memory of the Earl and Countess Fortescue who died within days of each other in 1958. Hugh Fortescue founded Filleigh school in 1861. It has been extended and now houses three classes: Infants (5 to 7 years old), Lower Juniors (7 to 9) and Upper Juniors (9 to 11). There was a major fire at Castle Hill on March 10, 1934. The house-keeper and another servant lost their lives in the fire, the house-keeper after alerting the other occupants of the house to the danger. Fire brigades from South Molton, Barnstaple, Tiverton and Bideford were summoned. Much valuable furniture was destroyed but most of the family silver was saved.
